Node Hardware

System Management

Comprehensive system monitoring and hardware information with remote node support and health checks. Provides detailed CPU, memory, and system information for HPC environments.

1.0.0 Version
3 Actions
Jul 19 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Quick Start

cd /path/to/scientific-mcps/Node_Hardware uv sync && uv run node-hardware-mcp

UV Package Manager

uv sync uv run node-hardware-mcp

Traditional pip

pip install -e . python -m src.server

Direct Execution

uv run node-hardware-mcp

Claude Desktop

{ "mcpServers": { "node-hardware-mcp": { "command": "uv", "args": [ "--directory", "/path/to/scientific-mcps/Node_Hardware", "run", "node-hardware-mcp" ] } } }

WARP Client

MCP: - Node_Hardware python3 bin/wrp.py --conf=bin/confs/Gemini.yaml

Claude CLI

claude add mcp node-hardware -- uv --directory ~/path/to/scientific-mcps/Node_Hardware run node-hardware-mcp

Available Actions

  • get_node_info
    Get comprehensive local node information including CPU, memory, disk, and network details
    Parameters: None
  • get_remote_node_info
    Get hardware information from remote nodes via SSH
    Parameters: hostname, username, ssh_key_path
  • health_check
    Perform comprehensive system health check with thresholds
    Parameters: cpu_threshold, memory_threshold, disk_threshold

Usage Examples

Local Hardware Information

get_node_info() get_node_info(components=['cpu', 'memory']) get_node_info(exclude_components=['processes', 'sensors']) get_node_info(components=['system', 'summary']) get_node_info(components=['cpu', 'memory', 'disk', 'performance']) get_node_info(components=['sensors', 'gpu'], include_health=True)

Remote Hardware Information

get_remote_node_info(hostname='server1.example.com') get_remote_node_info( hostname='192.168.1.100', username='admin', ssh_key='~/.ssh/id_rsa' ) get_remote_node_info( hostname='server1.example.com', username='admin', port=2222, timeout=60, components=['cpu', 'memory', 'disk'] )

High-Performance Remote Collection

get_remote_node_info( hostname='hpc-node-01', username='hpcuser', ssh_key='~/.ssh/hpc_key', timeout=120, components=['cpu', 'memory', 'gpu'] ) get_remote_node_info( hostname='cluster-node-01', components=['performance', 'summary'], include_performance=True, include_health=True )
